instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3S: What is PP3V3_G3S? PP3V3_G3S is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3S standby state. .

threads.title: MacBook Air 2019 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 not turning on
threads.message:
Hi,
We got an MacBook Air 2019 with is not turning on.
Does anyone have a schematic diagram for it, I found one link on forum but is locked can't download?
thanks

threads.title: MacBook Air 2019 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 not turning on
MacBook Air 2019 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 not turning on
threads.message:
Thanks for schematic for this Mac.
I have question actually trying to repair this board.
I have checked laptop drain 20v 2A from charger
there is 3.3v 5v G3H present 
power button have 3.3v once pressed changing <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
no voltage for CPU on L7410,L7430,L7210,L7290
This little LED next to battery connector is not lighting up battery voltage present 
any ideas? I didn't fix this boards before not sure if they have any week points ?
Board wasn't liquid damage laptop looks ok no physical damages.
Any help appreciated.

threads.title: MacBook Air 2019 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 not turning on
threads.message:
You didn't post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage.
Just went for CPU voltages and we don't know anything about other secondary voltages.

This could be another T2 firmware issue, like many of these f***g boards; use search function on the forum...

threads.title: MacBook Air 2019 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 not turning on
threads.message:
Okay i have tried T2 firmware. it tried restore in DFU mode and Recovery I getting only error: 
AMRestoreErrorDomain 10 - Failed to handle message type StatusMsg) [AMRestoreErrorDomain ? 0xA (10)]
also I do some research on google and looks like when laptop is in DFU mode it should show in USB Devices Tree as two: one Apple T2 Controller and second iBridge. iBridge is missing. 
Any more ideas ? I will have to back to secondary voltages I think check it all.

threads.title: MacBook Air 2019 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 not turning on
threads.message:
Post voltage for other big coils.
Also check all voltages from page 67.

BTW, someone reported to got T2 recovered only at third attempt...

threads.title: MacBook Air 2019 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 not turning on
threads.message:
okay I have done some measurements 

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3S</SIGNAL> 3.39v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3SSW_SNS</SIGNAL> 0v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 0v

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> 1.8v

<SIGNAL>P3V3SEN_SS</SIGNAL> 0v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_3GS</SIGNAL> 5v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3G</SIGNAL> 3.29v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.64v
tested only on charger, without battery.
I have tried many times restore this t2, chip want take firmware tired restore on OSX Catalina and Mojave no luck two different laptop also errors only nothing more. Have tired in DPU and restore mode. 
any help much appreciated

threads.title: MacBook Air 2019 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 not turning on
threads.message: is there a reason to fix this 2019 machine that should still be in warranty? What is the history here?

threads.title: MacBook Air 2019 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 not turning on
threads.message: according to apple website warranty expired so they brought it to get it fix if possible.. Its actually 2018 so very first ones I guess

threads.title: MacBook Air 2019 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 not turning on
threads.message: Looks like this was a EU purchase so you will have at least 2 year warranty if you can provide the original purchase invoice claiming EU consumer law. Do not mess with this T2 stuff unless you are 100% out of any sort of reclaim with Apple.
